instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B no video
threads.message:
Liquid Damaged board, around SMC, R5100 destroyed. 

-Reballed SMC, replaced R5100, added fresh solder to all resistor in the area, 
-Green light, then orange light. 
-SMC_RESET_L: 3V
-All big coils have voltage
-ALL_SYS_PWRGD: 3.34V
-PLT_RESET_L: 0V (not shorted to ground)

Any help?

Gracias

threads.title: 820-3437-B no video
threads.message: Check PM_PCH_PWROK, PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK, CPU_VR_READY and CPU_VCCST_PWRGD.

threads.title: 820-3437-B no video
threads.message:
Issue found thanks to your last comment
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK: 0V

Trace from PP3V42_G3H to PIN 8 of U1950 was broken.

Trace restored and board is working. 

Gracias V
